dmca.title: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist Notice!
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Tuesday, February 21, 2006 4:17 PM
To: Lashonda.Morris@pearsoned.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist Notice!]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.


- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html



- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist Notice!
Date: Tue, 21 Feb 2006 15:42:18 -0500
From: Morris, Lashonda <Lashonda.Morris@pearsoned.com>
To: 'ritagi2000@yahoo.com' <ritagi2000@yahoo.com>,        'info@betah.co.il'
<info@betah.co.il>,        'hostmaster@betah.co.il' <hostmaster@betah.co.il>
CC: 'abuse@theplanet.com' <abuse@theplanet.com>

 <<...OLE_Obj...>>

Pearson Education, Inc.
LaShonda Morris
One Lake Street                                                                Web
Security Specialist
Upper Saddle River, NJ  07458
Tel:    (201) 236-5803
Fax:   (201) 236-3400
Lashonda_Morris@pearsoned.com <mailto:Lashonda_Morris@pearsoned.com>

Date: February 21, 2006

www.betah.co.il <www.betah.co.il>
Attn: Rita Gemelfarb
3/25 Urugvai
Jerusalem  96701
Israel
Email: ritagi2000@yahoo.com; <mailto:ritagi2000@yahoo.com;> info@betah.co.il
<mailto:info@betah.co.il> ; hostmaster@betah.co.il

VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL

Dear Ms. Gemelfarb:
                
I am writing on behalf of Pearson Education, Inc. ("Pearson"), which owns
among other imprints the Addison Wesley, Cisco Press, Prentice Hall, Que,
and Sams publishing imprints.   It has come to Pearson's attention that your
website, http://www.betah.co.il/bookscatalog.aspx?category=programming
<http://www.betah.co.il/bookscatalog.aspx?category=programming>  (the
"Website"), reproduces and distributes unauthorized digital copies of
approximately 24 Pearson works ("Works"), examples of which are specified in
Exhibit A contained herein.

Pearson has not authorized copies of these proprietary Works to be
reproduced or distributed from your Website, or any other website, and we
are not aware that you have ever sought our permission to do so - permission
which in any case would not have been granted. Therefore, the unauthorized
reproduction and distribution of the Works on the Website are clear and
willful infringements of Pearson's copyright and exclusive rights as the
publisher of the Works under United States copyright law and international
copyright treaties
                
Be advised that Pearson considers infringement of any kind to be a grave
matter and Pearson vigorously protects its proprietary interests in its
Works. Therefore, as an initial matter, Pearson hereby demands that you
confirm in writing that you will immediately cease and desist all further
reproduction, display and making available for download of the Works on the
Website.

The demands made in this electronic mail shall not waive or prejudice any
rights or remedies which Pearson may have in connection with this matter,
including the right to commence legal action and to seek injunctive relief,
if necessary, without further notice to you.

Pearson expects a response confirming that the Work will be removed from
your Website no later than five (5) business days from your receipt of this
electronic mail.

Finally, you are hereby placed on notice that you are not authorized to, in
any manner, distribute such materials and therefore that any further
distribution will be deemed to be intentional and willful violation of our
rights.


Sincerely,
LaShonda Morris

cc: abuse@theplanet.com

                <EXHIBIT A>

1.  Linux Socket Programming By Example, First Edition by Warren Gay
ISBN: 0789722410

2. Absolute Beginner's Guide to Programming, Third Edition by Greg Perry
ISBN: 0789729059

3.  Special Edition Using Visual C++ 6 (Special Edition Using) by Kate
Gregory
ISBN: 0789715392

4.  XML How to Program, First Edition by Deitel
ISBN: 0130284173

5.  Java How to Program, Fourth Edition by Deitel
ISBN: 0130341517

6.  Visual Basic.NET How to Program, Second Edition by Deitel
ISBN: 0130293636

7.  Java After Hours: 10 Projects You'll Never Do at Work by Steve Holzner
ISBN: 0672327473

8.  Core C# and .NET by Stephen C. Perry
ISBN: 0131472275

9.  Microsoft Visual C# .NET 2003 Unleashed by Kevin Hoffman and Lonny
Kruger
ISBN: 0672326760

10.  C Primer Plus, Fifth Edition by Stephen Prata
ISBN: 0672326965

11.  C++ Template Metaprogramming : Concepts, Tools, and Techniques from
Boost and Beyond by David Abrahams and Aleksey Gurtovoy

12.  C++ Coding Standards: 101 Rules, Guidelines, and Best Practices by Herb
Sutter and Andrei Alexandrescu
ISBN: 0321113586

13.  SWT: The Standard Widget Toolkit, Volume 1 (The Eclipse Series) by
Steve Northover and Mike Wilson

14.  Imperfect C++: Practical Solutions for Real-Life Programming by Matthew
Wilson
ISBN: 0321228774

15.  Extreme Programming Explained: Embrace Change, Second Edition by Kent
Beck and Cynthia Andres
ISBN: 0321278658

16.  Find the Bug: A Book of Incorrect Programs by Adam Barr
ISBN: 0321223918

17.  eXtreme .NET: Introducing eXtreme Programming Techniques to .NET
Developers by Neil Roodyn
ISBN: 0321303636

18.  Sams Teach Yourself the C# Language in 21 Days by Bradley L. Jones
ISBN: 0672325462

19.  C++ Common Knowledge: Essential Intermediate Programming by Stephen C.
Dewhurst
ISBN: 0321321928

20.  The Programmer's Introduction to Visual Basic .NET by Craig Utley
ISBN: 0672322641

21.  The C Programming Language, Second Edition by Brian W. Kernighan,
ISBN: 0131103628

22.  Servlets and JSP: The J2EE Web Tier by Jayson Falkner and Kevin R Jones

ISBN: 0321136497

23.  MDA Distilled: Principles of Model-Driven Architecture by Stephen J.
Mellor
ISBN: 0201788918

24.  Windows System Programming, Third Edition by Johnson M. Hart
ISBN: 0321256190
